headline: AMD upgrade, HPE price target, Tesla robotaxi: Trending Tickers
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) was upgraded to Buy from Hold by HSBC and raised its price target to $200, highlighting the chipmaker's opportunity as an Nvidia (NVDA) rival. HPE (HPE) stock gains after Barclays lifted its price target for the stock, as enthusiasm about the company's recently closed deal with Juniper Networks (JNPR) reignites under the Trump administration. Tesla (TSLA) will expand its robotaxi service to San Francisco within the next two months, CEO Elon Musk said. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Why Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) Stock Is Trading Up Today
summary: Shares of enterprise technology company Hewlett Packard Enterprise (NYSE:HPE) jumped 3.4% in the afternoon session after Barclays raised its price target on the stock to $26 from $24, maintaining an overweight rating. The analyst's increased optimism follows HPE's recent completion of its acquisition of Juniper Networks, a leader in AI-native networking. This strategic purchase is significant as it doubles the size of HPE's networking business and strengthens its portfolio to better compete in t

headline: Analysis-Trump's antitrust enforcers 'get out of the way' of multibillion-dollar deals
summary: (Reuters) -President Donald Trump's antitrust enforcers recently cleared a string of multibillion-dollar deals in a week, demonstrating a willingness to settle with companies that marks a shift from the Biden administration.  The U.S. Department of Justice's Antitrust Division and the U.S. Federal Trade Commission cleared three deals that were together worth $63 billion in June, illustrating how FTC Chairman Andrew Ferguson and DOJ antitrust head Gail Slater are taking a different tack from their predecessors.  The settlements, along with a return to formally cutting short waiting periods, provide certainty to dealmakers and could smooth the path for companies like Nutella maker Ferrero, which on Thursday entered a deal to pay $3.1 billion for cereal maker WK Kellogg.

The settlements, along with a return to formally cutting short waiting periods, provide certainty to dealmakers and could smooth the path for companies like Nutella maker Ferrero, which on Thursday entered a deal to pay $3.1 billion for cereal maker WK Kellogg.

headline: Super Micro Is a ‘Show-Me Story.’ How Dell and HPE Are Giving the Company a Run for Its Money.
summary: As  Super Micro Computer  faces off against formidable competitors in the artificial-intelligence server market, analysts at  BofA  Securities don’t expect the stock to see outsize gains soon.  Analysts led by Ruplu Bhattacharya resumed coverage Wednesday on shares of the embattled server maker with an Underperform rating and a $35 price target.  While revenue growth can be high, this comes at the expense of margins, the BofA team said.
